review: I like that we can watch a picture slide show in our livingroom now. I like that we can listen to iTunes in our livingroom now. I like that we can watch some of our movies that are on our iTunes and nowhere else in our livingroom now. But we had to spend $20-30 on the new operating system to have it be compatable with our Mac. Then, we had to spend another $100 on Microsoft office because the version we had was outdated and not compatable with the new operating system we just got. Also, now my iPhoto has a hard time recognizing my memory card from my camera. And now Disney is no longer giving the iTunes digital download code with its DVDs so my kids won't be able to watch their Disney shows on our iPod, phones or Apple TV. The set up was extremely easy... But just not worth it, really, for us. We still have and continue to use it for what we can, but it hasn't changed our life or anything. It was a bday gift for husband and I wish I would have gotten him something else.

review: Many of the reviews did not mention many of the things that I was concerned about.  I was interested in a faster method of viewing Netflix.  I did my research and decided on the Apple tv.  The setup was very easy, even for someone like me with only a limited technical background.  I used a hard wire connection with cat 6 cables and a HDMI auto switch so I could hook up both the ATV and a blu ray to one one HDMI port on my TV  The increase in speed from turning on the equipment to watching a movie on Netflix was simply unbelievable.  No waiting for 20-30 seconds or more for the blu ray to load.  It was almost instantaneous and the improved navigation was wonderful.  Coupled with the simple design and Apples reputation for quality make me very glad that I chose the Apple tv.  I wanted a system that would last and not give out in a year or two.  The final reason I chose ATV was for its ability to view my pictures off of my other apple products.
